column1: Clamart (French pronunciation: ​[kla.maʁ]) is a commune in the southwestern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 8.7 km (5.4 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: The town is divided into two parts
column2: separated by a forest: bas Clamart
column4: and petit Clamart with urbanization developed in the 1960s replacing pea fields. The canton of Clamart includes only a part of the commune. The other part of the commune belongs to the canton of Le Plessis-Robinson.

column1: The city name is famous in French gastronomy. A specialty with peas as a side-dish
column2: is called "à la Clamart". Close to Paris and its central marketplace (Les Halles)
column3: Clamart's peas were the first of the season.

column1: On 22 August 1962 the French President Charles de Gaulle was the target of an assassination attempt organised by the French Air Force Lieutenant-Colonel
column2: Jean Bastien-Thiry. As de Gaulle's black Citroën DS 19 sped through Petit-Clamart it was met by a barrage of submachine-gun fire. De Gaulle and his entourage
column4: survived the attempt without any casualties or serious injuries while the attempt's perpetrators were subsequently all arrested and put on trial. The leader of the assassination attempt
column6: was executed by firing squad after his 1963 conviction
column7: and was the last person to be executed by firing squad in France.
